hero.title: I'm Adam Fratino
hero.description: (Yet another front-end developer with a background in design).
copy: The first bit of code I taught myself was a CSS snippet to hide the banner ads on an Angelfire site I made dedicated to Calvin & Hobbes, but I started feeling guilty so now I work client-side development at advertising agencies to make up for it.

I came to New York City to get my BFA in Graphic Design at the School of Visual Arts. I stuck around to write code at The Barbarian Group and Rokkan. I love pushing the limits of CSS, and modern Javascript is pretty fun too.
If you'd like to check out some code feel free to visit my CodePen or Github. If you want to see some of my art things check out my Cargo. Also have an outdated resume.
In case you care about my personality, I own a fat cat, I play in Skee-Ball and Shuffleboard leagues, and I want to break the world record in Tapper.

projects.title: Sometimes I make things.
projects.description: I'm always trying to find some free time to work on a personal project. Sometimes I'll make something because I need it and it'll make my life easier, but usually I'll just get something in my head and see where it takes me. Most of the time the result is that I learned something new.

project.title: Casio Watch
project.description: Rebuilding the classic Casio digital watch with some basic functionality and a lot of advanced styling.

project.title: Table-to-JSON
project.description: Born from a need to convert lots of tables to lots of JSON, definitely nothing fancy but it gets the job done.

project.title: Tekken Rooster [WIP]
project.description: I tried coming up with a cool way to automate a visual sidekick for the frame data from the JSON files. It's hard.

footer.title: Thanks for visiting!
copy: Hopefully you've got a decent idea of who I am by now. I'm always interested in contributing to new projects, so hit me up if you think I have the skills you're looking for. (You can find my email address in the console log).
